title: Indian banks selling retail loan portfolios as deposits lag
description: India's private banks, pressured by regulators to improve credit-deposit ratios, have started selling retail loan portfolios. HDFC Bank sold a $597 million loan portfolio in June, and IDFC First Bank sold retail loans to Citigroup. Several lenders are now exploring similar deals for better CD ratios.
